Review.Titre: VERY EVASIVE  in transaction dispute resolution
Review.Contenu: Generally, the service has been OK but when I had an issue with a transaction (I had purchased credit for my wife's internet account but the credit was never given by the Cuban telecom company ETECSA) so I tried s verbal times asking either for the purchased credit or reversal of the transaction, hablacuba continued to respond by sending generic emails claiming that ETECSA had properly credited my account which of course was false. What was even more bothersome was hablacuba's refusal to accept responsibility for their error and their insistence that the issue had nothing to do with them and that I had to take my complaints to ETECSA. When I asserted that the transaction was between hablacuba and me and that ETECSA would not even recognize my complaint (technically, perhaps ETECSA was correct because it was hablacuba who had charged my credit card), hablacuba went silent on me. I thought, in that scenario, they were very evasive and irresponsible. AT THE END and inspite of all my efforts,  I WAS CHARGED FOR THE REDIT THAT WAS NEVER GIVEN! So I took my complaint to American Express and they credited my Amex account.

Review.Titre: Thanks for helping me purchase cell minutes for my friend
Review.Contenu: I am in the US and HablaCuba has helped me contribute to my friend and former translator in Cuba.  I am afraid to send money through the mail for fear it will be confiscated or stolen.  I was warned not to do this while in Cuba in 2016 (when it was still legal to visit there)  They have been a lifesaver to help me communicate by email.  I have found them very honest and never had any problems getting minutes to my friend's cellphone.On the negative side, I did not understand how to purchase minutes and my translator could not explain beyond telling me others use this method.  The site seems to be mostly for Spanish speaking users, although it is translated into English for those that do not know Spanish.  There is just not much information to explain things.  For example, there are other things available on the site than cell minutes, but I do not understand what they are for.Thank you for your invaluable service to the continuing friendship between our two nations.
